meanings.sent1: The subscription was cancellable with just a phone call.
meanings.sent2: The hotel room booking was cancellable up to 24 hours before check-in.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a cancellable magic spell - just say 'cancel' and it disappears!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cancellable cloud, fleeting and easily dissipated.
meanings.sent5: The cancellable nature of the appointment made it easy to change plans last minute.

meanings.definition: Capable of being terminated or annulled
meanings.sent1: The contract was cancellable if either party failed to meet the terms.
meanings.sent2: The agreement had a cancellable clause that allowed for termination in case of breach.
meanings.sent3: His excuses were as cancellable as a paper boat in a storm - they didn't hold up.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was cancellable, dissipating as soon as the apology was offered.
meanings.sent5: The cancellable nature of the lease gave them flexibility in case they needed to move suddenly.
